references.paper_title: Geometric deep learning: Grids, groups, graphs, geodesics, and gauges
references.reason: This paper lays the theoretical groundwork for geometric deep learning, providing the conceptual framework and mathematical tools for designing and analyzing models that leverage the geometric structure of data.

This paper introduces the Geometric Algebra Transformer (GATr), a novel architecture that is equivariant to the Euclidean group E(3), which is foundational to the L-GATr architecture proposed in the main paper.
This paper introduces the Clifford Group Equivariant Neural Networks (CGENN), a Lorentz-equivariant architecture that is directly compared against the proposed L-GATr in the experiments.

references.paper_title: Riemannian flow matching on general geometries
references.reason: This paper introduces Riemannian flow matching, a generative modeling technique used to train the Lorentz-equivariant generative model in the main paper.
This paper introduces the Transformer architecture, which is the foundation of both GATr and the proposed L-GATr.
